titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives

titlepage.p: © 2009 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Broadcast scripts, memoranda, letters, clippings, photographs, and sound recordings, relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasts to Poland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Barbara Nawratowicz papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2005.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Radio Free Europe Polish section music director.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Broadcast scripts, memoranda, letters, clippings, photographs, and sound recordings, relating to Radio Free Europe broadcasts to Poland.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Radio broadcasting--Poland.

did.unittitle: Correspondence, clippings, and RFE/RL Polish service transcripts

scopecontent.p: Box spine label reads: C82670 KURANT

PIOSENKI RADIOWE RFE Strone - A (1) W.Krajewski - "Szumia fale Baltyku" 23 35" (2) Same as number 1 ----2'40" lepsze (3) W Krajewski-"Dla mej matki piesn" 2'53" - + (4) J.Koryzme-"Nowyszal-bossa nova"-3'20 (5) K. Kaliszewska-"Il mondo"-3'20" -+ (6) K. Kaliszewska (J.Katelbach?)-"By-by Billy - 2'24" (7) Muzyczny przerywnik-Mario Sarachino 2'07" (8) Same as number 7 - + - 2'10" (9) K. Kaliszewska-"Wenecje"-2'43" (10) B. Nawratowicz-"zostah tu" - 1'50"
Box spine label has the recording as C34587; reel flange label has the recording as C79709
Concerns the audio inauguration of Radio Free Europe

Piosenki Wybrzeza 1970 - B (1) "Co sie komu nalezv - Melodeklama B.Jerke - 1'30" (2) "Wziac to czego niema"-J.Marchw winski - 1'05" (3) "Gomulka" -W.Krajewski B.Jerks 2'42"x (4) "17go grudnia 70go"-piesn stocznicwcow -W.Krajewski -2'30" xxx (5) "Baltyk" -B.Nawratowicz-3'09" (zryw Wybrzeza) (6) "16-go grudnia roku pamietnego"-Gierek! -B.Jerke x chor 3'35" / -a- strona Muzyka - .Sarachino
Box spine label has the tape as C44432; reel flange label has the tape as C62073

POLACY NA ZACHODZIE. See tape information sheet inside of the box.
Case spine label reads: POSENKI
Tape C63442
Two songs related to dogs. The first is a song where the melody is performed by dog barks. The second is "(How Much Is) That Doggie in the Window." Tape C77993
